resources.string: A short introduction and general overview
The Kubriko game engine is a lightweight, scalable, and easy-to-use solution for creating simple, 2D games that target the Android, Desktop (Windows, Linux, macOS), iOS, or Web platforms.

Kubriko is based on Compose Multiplatform, and is written 100% in Kotlin. As a result, it can seamlessly be integrated into any Compose project.\n\nFor more information, check out the GitHub repository. If you run into any issues / bugs, have feature request ideas, or would like to contribute in any other way, that is the starting point:
To learn more about using the engine, check out how to create a new project and read the documentation.

Watching the step by step tutorial videos is a great way to understand how the simple games in this app are implemented. You can also join our Discord server to discuss more advanced topics with the community, or to promote your own creations.
Kubriko is under active development and will evolve together with the games that are being created with it. It's completely open source and free to use under MPL 2.0.
This Showcase app contains a number of games, demos, and tests that present what the engine is capable of.\n\n
